00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantPlierBase.h
00024  * @author Pete Klosterman
00025  * @date   Wed Feb 22 10:55:22 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Base class for doing probe set quantification using either
00028  * the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method or
00029  * the ITER-PLIER method, which iteratively calls PLIER with the
00030  * probes that best correlate with signal estimate.
00031  */
00032 #ifndef _QUANTPLIERBASE_H_
00033 #define _QUANTPLIERBASE_H_
00034 
00035 //
00036 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/QuantPlierParams.h"
00038 //
00039 #include "plier/affyplier.h"
00040 #include "util/Convert.h"
00041 #include "util/Err.h"
00042 //
00043 #include <cstring>
00044 #include <map>
00045 #include <string>
00046 //
00047 
00048 /**
00049  *  Base class for doing probe set quantification using either
00050  * the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method or
00051  * the ITER-PLIER method, which iteratively calls PLIER with the
00052  * probes that best correlate with signal estimate.
00053  */
00054 class QuantPlierBase : public QuantExprMethod {
00055 
00056 public:
00057 
00058   /**
00059    * Constructor. 
00060    */
00061   QuantPlierBase(QuantPlierParams &plierParams);
00062 
00063   /**
00064    * Destructor.
00065    */
00066   virtual ~QuantPlierBase();
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00070    * set, chip layout and data.
00071    * 
00072    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00073    * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00074    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00075    * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00076    * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00077    * @return bool - True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00078    */
00079   bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00080              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00081 
00082   /** 
00083    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00084    * @return true or false if getFeatureEffects() supplies estimates.
00085    */
00086   bool haveFeatureEffects();
00087 
00088   /** 
00089    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00090    * @return Return true if getResidual() works, false otherwise.
00091    */
00092   bool haveResiduals();
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00096    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00097    * @return feature (probe) effects.
00098    */
00099   double getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx);
00100   
00101   /** 
00102    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00103    * primary interest.
00104    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00105    * @return estimated intensity.
00106    */
00107   double getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx);
00108 
00109   /** 
00110    * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by
00111    * model). Supplied as log_2() transformed.
00112    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00113    * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00114    * @return intensity not explained by model.
00115    */
00116   double getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx);
00117 
00118   /** 
00119    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00120    * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00121    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00122    * @return estimated intensity.
00123    */
00124   double getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx);
00125 
00126   /** 
00127    * @brief Clear out all the data.
00128    */
00129   void clear();
00130 
00131   /** 
00132    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00133    * 
00134    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00135    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00136    * @param data - Data to be set.
00137    */
00138   void setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data);
00139 
00140 /** 
00141    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00142    * 
00143    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00144    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00145    */
00146   double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx);
00147 
00148   /** 
00149    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00150    * 
00151    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00152    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00153    * @param data - Data to be set.
00154    */
00155   void setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data);
00156 
00157   /** 
00158    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00159    * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00160    * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00161    */
00162   void setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips);  
00163 
00164   /** 
00165    * @brief Do the heavy lifting of plier or iter-plier.
00166    */
00167   virtual void computeEstimate() = 0;
00168 
00169   /** 
00170    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00171    * @return feature count.
00172    */
00173   virtual unsigned int getNumFeatures() = 0;
00174 
00175   /** 
00176    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00177    * @return target count
00178    */
00179   unsigned int getNumTargets();
00180 
00181   /** 
00182    * @brief Specify precomputed feature effects to be used as map from
00183    * probe id index to the feature effect.  This make plier much
00184    * faster to do as doesn't have to iterate through anything, but
00185    * have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the
00186    * analysis that is being done. For example the feature effects
00187    * might be different using pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.
00188    * 
00189    * Note: this is only used by plier, not by iter-plier.
00190    * 
00191    * @param featureEffects - mapping from probe idex to feature effects.
00192    */
00193   virtual void setFeaturePriorEffects(double* featureEffects, int iSize) = 0;
00194 
00195   /** 
00196    * @brief Fill the plier parameters object based on the user-defined
00197    * key/value pairs.
00198    * The default values used for the plier parameters are from the
00199    * inputs.txt file in the sdk example.
00200    * 
00201    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00202    * @param plierParams - Plier parameters object to fill.
00203    */
00204   static void fillPlierParams(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param, 
00205                               QuantPlierParams &plierParams,
00206                               SelfDoc &doc);
00207 
00208   /** 
00209    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00210    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00211    */
00212   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00213 
00214 protected :
00215 
00216   /** 
00217    * @brief Allocate enough memory for at least maxChips and
00218    * maxProbes.
00219    * 
00220    * @param maxChips - Number of chips that can be computed.
00221    * @param maxProbes - Number of probes or features that can be computed.
00222    */
00223   virtual void allocMemory(unsigned int maxChips, unsigned int maxProbes) = 0;
00224 
00225   /** 
00226    * @brief Free up all the memory that has been allocated.
00227    */
00228   virtual void freeMemory() = 0;
00229 
00230   /** 
00231    * @brief Use this to toggle whether or not QuantPlier should be using
00232    * precomputed feature effects (aka feature response, sometimes know incorrectly as 'affinity').
00233    * Much faster to do as plier doesn't have to iterate through anything, but
00234    * have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the analysis that
00235    * is being done. For example the feature effects might be different using
00236    * pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.
00237    * 
00238    * @param value - true if using precomputed feature effects false otherwise.
00239    */
00240   void setUsePrecompFeatureEffects(bool value);
00241 
00242   /**
00243    * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00244    */
00245   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board);
00246 
00247 
00248   /// Instance of plier to be used.
00249   caffyplier m_Plier;
00250   /// PM data matrix (double** as  that is what plier uses.)
00251   double **m_PM;
00252   /// MM data matrix (double** as  that is what plier uses.)
00253   double **m_MM;
00254   /// Residual matrix (double** as  that is what plier uses.) log_2 transformed.
00255   double **m_Residuals;
00256   /// Effects attributed to probe (feature) and chips by model
00257   double *m_ProbeEffects, *m_ChipEffects;
00258   /// Number of chips and counts in this probe set analysis.
00259   unsigned int m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount;
00260   /// Map of probe ids to feature effects.
00261   double* m_FeaturePriorEffect;
00262   /// Maximum number of chips and probes that can be done without
00263   /// reallocating more memory.
00264   unsigned int m_MaxChips, m_MaxProbes;
00265 
00266 private :
00267 
00268   /** 
00269    * @brief Plier has a lot of parameters. Lets set as many as possible in
00270    * one place... Got default parameters from the inputs.txt file
00271    * in the sdk example.
00272    * @param plier - plier class to set parameters for.
00273    */
00274   void setPlierParams(iaffyplier &plier, QuantPlierParams &plierParams);
00275 
00276   /// Should we use the precomputed probe effects in m_ProbePriorEffect?
00277   bool m_UsePrecompEffects;
00278 };
00279 
00280 #endif /* _QUANTPLIERBASE_H_ */
